techmeme.title: Elon Musk said xAI brought its "Colossus 100k H100 training cluster online" over the weekend, which will "double in size to 200k (50k H200s) in a few months" (Christiaan Hetzner/Fortune)
Spotter debuts a set of AI tools called Spotter Studio, to help creators brainstorm video ideas by analyzing 2B+ top YouTube videos and more, for $49/month (Lauren Forristal/TechCrunch)
Coinbase, Brian Armstrong, and their super PACs haven't donated to Trump or Harris, instead pursuing a strategy of targeted donations to congressional campaigns (Bloomberg)
Some Big Tech critics worry that Kamala Harris' deep ties to tech companies could prompt her to abandon Democrats' recent aggressive stance toward the sector (Washington Post)
Sydney-based Canva announces a price increase, including hikes of 300% for some users, citing its new AI and generative AI features, as it prepares for a US IPO (Denham Sadler/Information Age)
